author: eTN Editor
title: IUCN Asia: Solutions to Asia’s most urgent environment challenges - in pictures
text:
IUCN Asia: Solutions to Asia’s most urgent environment challenges - in pictures   
By Andrew J. Wood, eTN Thailand Correspondent | Aug 11, 2015 All photos © Andrew J. Wood Banners   
BANGKOK, Thailand - The 6th IUCN Asia Regional Conservation Forum – one of Asia’s most important events to tackle biodiversity and ecosystem conservation – kicked off with a strong focus on bringing together a wide diversity of sectors to forge solutions to the region’s pressing environment and development challenges. 
The forum is co-hosted by the Ministry of Natural Resources and Environment (MONRE), the government of Thailand, and the IUCN (International Union for Conservation of Nature) through the National Committee of IUCN members in Thailand. 
Enjoy seeing the forum as it was captured in pictures.
